doc.after: JosÃ© Caro RodrÃ­guez was born in Cahuil, O'Higgins, as the fourth of the nine children of JosÃ© MarÃ­a Caro MartÃ­nez and his wife Rita RodrÃ­guez Cornejo. After attending a local school, he entered the seminary in Santiago in 1881. Caro then went to Rome in 1887, studying at the Pontifical Collegio Pio-Latinoamericano and the Pontifical Gregorian University until 1891. Ordained to the priesthood on December 20, 1890, he returned to Chile in October 1891 and then taught preparatory studies and philosophy at the Santiago seminary.
